messages.subject: four or so topics to discuss
messages.msgSnippet: Well, saying yes to your kids has been big the last couple of days. I know that s what helped me more than any other thing: THINK about what they re asking,
messages.messageBody:
Well, saying yes to your kids has been big the last couple of days. I know
that's what helped me more than any other thing: THINK about what they're
asking, before shooting off an automatic "no" to their requests.

Also, I must say what helped me a lot at the beginning, was writing out
"Everything I've Ever Learned" in one hour-long free association journal
entry. Per Sandra's advice, I think it was.

those two things helped me at the beginning.

blessings, HeidiC

>I thought that maybe having a set of four or more informal rotating topics
>might be useful for this list.
>
>
>====================
>
>That could be fun to at least try for one rotation.
>
>So what are the four or more topics people need to discuss to get
>unschooling?
>
>In LLL, weaning/solids (for example) comes around once a month, and not
>all
>the moms are needing it every time, but some people only go to four
>meetings
>and have to do with what they can from memory and books if they don't want
>to
>go back.
>
>Sandra
>
>
